{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Card[source]

Card(suit=0, rank=2)

Represents a standard playing card.

Attributes: suit: integer 0-3 rank: integer 1-13

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Card is a class that represents a single card in deck of cards. For example:

{% raw %} 
Card(suit=1, rank=3)

3 of Diamonds
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
c = Card(suit=1, rank=3)
assert str(c) == '3 of Diamonds'

c2 = Card(suit=2, rank=11)
assert str(c2) == 'Jack of Hearts'
{% endraw %}

You can do comparisions of cards, too!

{% raw %}

Card.__lt__[source]

Card.__lt__(other)

Compares this card to other, first by suit, then rank. returns: boolean

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert c > c2, 'somthing is wrong'

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AssertionError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_2248/2661455636.py in <module>
----> 1 assert c > c2, 'somthing is wrong'

AssertionError: somthing is wrong
{% endraw %}
